intro: Cordylostigma stellarioides, commonly known as the star-like sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-angled, three-lobed berries. Cordylostigma stellarioides is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
